prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a central hole that runs through its length.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will create a coordinate system aligned with the global coordinate system. Now, create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create two loops - loop 1 and loop 2 - each consisting of a single circle. For loop 1, create a circle centered at [0.2024, 0.2024] with a radius of 0.2024. This will create the outer diameter of the cylindrical object. For loop 2, create a circle concentric with the first circle but with a smaller radius of 0.0364. This will create the inner diameter of the cylindrical object, forming a hole through the center of the part. With the sketch complete, scale it by a factor of 0.4047. Now, rotate the scaled 2D sketch into 3D space using the Euler angles defined in the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.1781 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Apply the "New Body Feature Operation" boolean operation to create a new solid body. The resulting part will have the following dimensions: - Height: 0.1781 - Width: 0.4047 - Length: 0.4047 **Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top edge.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system.
